SVGAttributeMarker-end.summary: The marker-end attribute defines the arrowhead or polymarker that will be drawn at the final vertex of the given shape.

remarks.para: For all shape elements, except polyline and path, the last vertex is the same as the first vertex. In this case, if the value of {{SVGAttr("marker-start")}} and marker-end are both not none, then two markers will be rendered on that final vertex. For <path> elements, for each closed subpath, the last vertex is the same as the first vertex. marker-end is only rendered on the final vertex of the path data.

blockquote.para: Note: As a presentation attribute, marker-end can be used as a CSS property.

remarks.para: You can use this attribute with the following SVG elements:
